intro: Staurogeton, commonly known as the starwort, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers, which typically consist of five petals arranged radially. The plants are generally herbaceous, with slender stems and opposite leaves that are often lanceolate in shape. Staurogeton species are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including parts of Europe, Asia, and North America. They are often found in moist, well-drained soils in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks.
